posts.body:
Nice, hope more are coming soon!

PS. Add them to [Important Zites](/1MiS3ud9JogSQpd1QVmM6ETHRmk5RgJn6E), it has this great feature where you can search all merger hubs for a zite.

posts.subject: Church desacration in France
posts.body:
Fires could be accidents, but are included. We can figure out what caused them later. If it has been proven to be an attack I will change it to "arson".

2019:
* January 16: Fire at Saint-Jaques (Grenoble)
* January 29: Two attacks on Saint-Nicolas (Houilles)
* February 3: Vandalism and looting at Saint-Pierre (Talmont)
* February 4: Statue of Mary smashed in St. Nicolas church (Houilles)
* February 5: Arson and vandalism at St.-Alain Cathedral (Lavaur)
* February 6: Vandalism and looting at Notre-Dame des Enfants (NÃ®mes)
* February 9: Altar in Notre-Dame vandalised (Dijon)
* February 10:  Vandalism at St.-Nicolas (Maisons-Lafitte)
* March 17: Arson at St. Sulpice (Paris)
* April 15: Fire (allegedly caused by work accident) at the Notre Dame (Paris)

According to ''The Tablet'' 47 documented attacks on churches and religious sites in February of 2019 alone, but they don't provide a list. If you find articles about other attacks post links.
